column1: Om en blind leder en blind, så faller de båda i gropen.
column2: If a blind leads a blind man both shall fall into a ditch.
column3: A person ignorant or inexperienced in something cannot assist someone similar.

column1: Om kvällen får den late brått.
column2: During the evening the lazy get in a hurry.

column1: Om man ger någon ett finger vill han ha hela handen.
column2: Give him an inch and he will take a yard.
column3: People are inclined to take excessive advantage of the tolerance or generosity of others; often used to warn against making even the smallest concession.

column1: Ont krut förgås inte så lätt.
column2: Evil gun powder doesn’t go away easily.
Fight fire with fire; Like cures like.
Be quick to act, and slow to promise.
column3: Avoid making promises (to yourself as well).
Said when it is felt that someone hasn’t received the praise or compensation he deserves.
